answers.answer: I had the same issue with my first! And craved sweets with her too lol no salty food. They did stress tests to make sure everything was ok, which it was. Pretty sure it was my nerves! Just try to breath and get yourself relaxed before they even  call you back. I know it's hard but eventually you'll be ok. My first appt this time mine was a little high but I breath in and out before hand and get relaxed and it's been fine since.

I have the same exact issue too! I tried explaining to the doc that my nerves are crazy when I have apts and that's what causes it but she prescribed a mild bp med. She isn't even my ob and ill be seeing my ob soon so I decided against taking it until I consult with my doc and see what she thinks. I have no advice for you though I wish I did! My hands sweat and everything! Its bad. I just try to keep distracted.
Thanks ladies! Glad I'm not the only one!

Mine was always high with my last pregnancy and they had me doing a urine test where I had to collect it in a container for 24hrs...sucked sooo bad but come to find out it was only high when I first got to my appt. Because of my nerves so they would wait 10-15 min for me to calm down and come check it again and BAM no high BP :-) ask them to do that
Try not to be in a hurry when you have an appointment, and do something relaxing that morning. It might not help a lot, but if it's just barely too high, it could possibly be nerves.
Just make sure they test your urine too, every time, because preeclampsia is no joke.
Allowing your breathing down will lower your blood pressure. As soon as you get settled at the doctor, start taking long deep breaths in your nose, out your mouth.

question: So, the last couple times I've been to my doctor appointments my blood pressure is a little high. My doc said to cut salt. The thing is I don't eat anything salty or use it when I cook. Baby prefers sweets. Lol. I Have a blood pressure monitor at home and it's always low or perfect. I'm almost positive it's my nerves and worried if baby is ok. Any advice or tips on to calm myself and my nerves before my appointments??? Thanks ladies!
